message:
I've worked on a rails app in rails 2.3.8 with several plugins (delayed_job, csv processing, authlogic)

How much work is involved in converting it to rails 3?

Has anyone else looked into this/done this before? How long did it take? Is it worth it?

Thanks!

I've done it with the help of this book: http://www.railsupgradehandbook.com/ -- It didn't take long to just make it work on Rails 3, but to fully take advantage of Rails 3 features I'd have to spend a couple more days on it. I think it will depend on how your application is written and if all your plugins/gems are compatible.
Thanks @ivanyv! That looks like a great resource, will check it out.
You might also want to checkout the 3 part "Upgrading to rails 3" screencast's. http://railscasts.com/episodes/225-upgrading-to-rails-3-part-1 . It should help you with your upgrade.
Shouldn't take too much work, and the new active relation api and routes changes make the upgrade really worth the effort.
